HelpXML.Title: FSRaddt
HelpXML.Purpose: FSRaddt produces t deletion tests for each explanatory variable.

Item.Name: y
Item.ShortDesc: A vector with n elements that contains the response variable
Item.TypeInd: y can be both a row of column vector

Item.Name: X
Item.ShortDesc: Data matrix of explanatory variables (also called 'regressors') of dimension (n x p-1)
Item.TypeInd: Rows of X represent observations, and columns represent variables
Item.LongDesc: Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: intercept
Item.ShortDesc: Indicator for constant term
Item.LongDesc: If 1, a model with constant term will be fitted (default), if 0, no constant term will be included.

Item.Name: h
Item.ShortDesc: The number of observations that have determined the least trimmed squares estimator
Item.LongDesc: h is an integer greater or equal than [(n+size(X,2)+1)/2] but smaller then n

Item.Name: nsamp
Item.ShortDesc: Number of subsamplse which will be extracted to find the robust estimator
Item.LongDesc: If nsamp=0 all subsets will be extracted. They will be (n choose p). Remark: if the number of all possible subset is <1000 the default is to extract all subsets otherwise just 1000.

Item.Name: lms
Item.ShortDesc: Criterion to use to find the initlal subset to initialize the search
Item.LongDesc: If lms=1 (default) Least Median of Squares is computed, else Least Trimmed of Squares is computed. else (default) no plot is produced

Item.Name: init
Item.ShortDesc: Search initialization
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which specifies the initial subset size to start monitoring exceedances of minimum deletion residual, if init is not specified it will be set equal to: p+1, if the sample size is smaller than 40; min(3*p+1,floor(0.5*(n+p+1))), otherwise.

Item.Name: plots
Item.ShortDesc: Plot on the screen
Item.LongDesc: If plots=1 a plot with forward deletion t-statistics is produced

Item.Name: nameX
Item.ShortDesc: Add variable labels in plot
Item.LongDesc: Cell array of strings of length p containing the labels of the varibles of the regression dataset. If it is empty (default) the sequence X1, ..., Xp will be created automatically

Item.Name: lwdenv
Item.ShortDesc: Line width for envelopes
Item.LongDesc: Line width for envelopes based on student T (default is 2)

Item.Name: quant
Item.ShortDesc: Confidence quantiles for the envelopes
Item.LongDesc: Confidence quantiles for the envelopes of deletion t stat. Default is [0.005 0.995] (i.e. a 99% pointwise confidence interval)

Item.Name: lwdt
Item.ShortDesc: Line width for deletion T stat

Item.Name: nocheck
Item.ShortDesc: Check input arguments
Item.LongDesc: If nocheck is equal to 1 no check is performed on matrix y and matrix X. Notice that y and X are left unchanged. In other words the additional column of ones for the intercept is not added. As default nocheck=0.

Item.Name: titl
Item.ShortDesc: a label for the title

Item.Name: labx
Item.ShortDesc: a label for the x-axis

Item.Name: laby
Item.ShortDesc: a label for the y-axis

Item.Name: FontSize
Item.ShortDesc: the font size of the labels of the axes and of the labels inside the plot

Item.Name: SizeAxesNum
Item.ShortDesc: size of the numbers of the axes

Item.Name: ylimy
Item.ShortDesc: minimum and maximum of the y axis

Item.Name: xlimx
Item.ShortDesc: minimum and maximum of the x axis

ItemCell.Description: (n-init+1) x (p+1) matrix containing the monitoring of deletion t stat in each step of the forward search 1st col = fwd search index (from init to n) 2nd col = deletion t stat for first explanatory variable 3rd col = deletion t stat for second explanatory variable ... (p+1)th col = deletion t stat for pth explanatory variable

(n-init+1) x (p+1) matrix containing the monitoring of deletion t stat in each step of the forward search 1st col = fwd search index (from init to n) 2nd col = deletion t stat for first explanatory variable 3rd col = deletion t stat for second explanatory variable ... (p+1)th col = deletion t stat for pth explanatory variable

cell of size p. out.Una{i} (i=1, ..., p) is a (n-init) x 11 matrix which contains the unit(s) included in the subset at each step in the search which excludes the ith explanatory variable. REMARK: in every step the new subset is compared with the old subset. Un contains the unit(s) present in the new subset but not in the old one Un(1,:) for example contains the unit included in step init+1 ... Un(end,2) contains the units included in the final step of the search

References.Item: Atkinson, A.C. and Riani, M. (2002b). Forward search added variable t tests and the effect of masked outliers on model selection. Biometrika, Vol. 89, pp. 939-946.
